newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: POSCO says takes over Sammi plant.
newsitem.headline: POSCO says takes over Sammi plant.

text.p: South Korea's Pohang Iron and Steel Co Ltd (POSCO) said it had taken over a Sammi Steel Co Ltd plant in Changwon and rights to its steel pipe and bar technology for a total of 719.4 billion won ($828 million.
"We have agreed to take over part of Sammi Steel," said a statement from POSCO.
The plant to be sold to POSCO is equipped to produce 750,000 tonnes of steel pipes and bars per year.
The steel maker said it was still negotiating the purchase of Sammi's stainless steel operations in Canada and the United States.
In December, Sammi had announced it was in talks with POSCO to sell parts of its stainless steel business due to recent financial difficulties. ($1 = 868.70)
